messageBody:
Thanks for the reply.

Could you supply some useful link?

Regards,
Marko

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Joshua Kerievsky <jlk@...> wrote:
>
> On Fri, Feb 20, 2009 at 5:25 AM, majkic@... <majkic@...> wrote:
>
> > I need to create automated acceptance tests. Selenium seems to be
> > nice, since it allows someone without much (or none at all)
> > programming experience, as our Product Owner to create those tests
> > with Firefox Selenium IDE plug-in.
> >
> > But time has come to integrate those tests to other JUnit tests, so
> > these can be run on CI server.
> >
> > Is there any know-how or link which could help. I already visited
> > mavenium (http://mavenium.sourceforge.net/index.html) and
> > maven2-selenium plug-in
> > site(http://mojo.codehaus.org/selenium-maven-plugin/index.html), but
> > documentation is not quite clear, or at least I couldn't run my tests.
> >
> > As I understood, selenium-rc should run automatically if defined in
> > pom.xml and then Selenium JUnit tests should run fine. What about
> > jetty? Is it run implicitly, or some server should be run? If not
> > automatically, should it be run manually? In this case CI doesn't make
> > sense, since you have to deploy application to some other server.
> >
> > Huh...too many questions, I guess. I would be happy to have at least
> > some answers.
>
>
> In general, we much prefer Selenium Core to Selenium RC (which we
had used
> for a while). You can write all your Selenium Core tests in JUnit and
> they'll run in the browsers. We even run our Se Core tests in
parallel for
> maximum speed.
>
> We started an eLearning album called Mastering Selenium, yet we
aren't very
> far along on it. When it gets more mature, you could check it out,
if you
> like. Just ping me about it.
>
> --
> best regards,
